alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 4:28PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lewis and Clark and southwestern Cascade Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 427 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Wolf Creek, or 20 miles west of Cascade, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cascade, Bowmans Corner, Tower Rock State Park and Craig. This includes the following highways... Interstate 15 between mile markers 230 and 260. Highway 200 between mile markers 98 and 115. Highway 287 between mile markers 1 and 25. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for central and west central Montana.
